intro: Cyphocarpa kuehlweiniana var. melanacantha, commonly known as the black-stemmed kuehlwein. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, characterized by its distinctive dark-colored stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
